Rep: Greg Murphy, the primary sponsor of the STOP Act, made the claim that "Every day, four North Carolinians die from a medication or drug overdose."
The claim made by Rep: Murphy has been repeatedly quoted or paraphrased in the news, indicating its widespread dissemination.
The North Carolina Department of Health: there were 1,370 deaths due to unintentional poisonings, with 93% (1,274) of those being drug overdoses, supporting Rep. Murphy's claim.
While Rep: Murphy's claim specifically refers to all drug overdoses, the STOP Act focuses solely on limiting the supply of prescription painkillers, indicating a narrower scope for the proposed legislation.
